page.title: 02HECKMONDWIKE AND DISTRICT 2.
page.content: Old housing still exists adjacent to industrial sectors along main roads following the valley bottoms. Slum clearance and re-development schemes abound. On valley side slopes are a mixture of old detached higher class housing, post war estates of semi- detached houses and farmland mainly dairying. The interfluves have much farmland often designated 'Green Belt' with more modern private and council housing estates. The patchwork quilt of industry and housing of various ages, styles and locations along with small farms make the area particularly interesting though at first sight visually unattractive. Socially the area is deprived, below the national average in several criteria including a high % in socio- economic classes III & IV. In 1985 unemployment was 12% though part time work is common.
